routes.documentation: Get API usage by application for time frame specified. You can go as far back as 30 days ago, and can ask for up to a 48 hour window of time in a single request. You must be authenticated with at least the ReadUserData permission to access this endpoint.

responses.label: Look at the Response property for more information about the nature of this response

routes.documentation: Get list of applications created by Bungie.

responses.label: Look at the Response property for more information about the nature of this response

routes.documentation: Returns community content.

responses.label: Look at the Response property for more information about the nature of this response

routes.documentation: Returns a content item referenced by id

responses.label: Look at the Response property for more information about the nature of this response

routes.documentation: Returns the newest item that matches a given tag and Content Type.

responses.label: Look at the Response property for more information about the nature of this response

routes.documentation: Gets an object describing a particular variant of content.

responses.label: Look at the Response property for more information about the nature of this response

routes.documentation: Gets content based on querystring information passed in. Provides basic search and text search capabilities.

responses.label: Look at the Response property for more information about the nature of this response

routes.documentation: Searches for Content Items that match the given Tag and Content Type.

responses.label: Look at the Response property for more information about the nature of this response

routes.documentation: Search for Help Articles.

responses.label: Look at the Response property for more information about the nature of this response

routes.documentation: Equip an item. You must have a valid Destiny Account, and either be in a social space, in orbit, or offline.

responses.label: Look at the Response property for more information about the nature of this response

routes.documentation: Equip a list of items by itemInstanceIds. You must have a valid Destiny Account, and either be in a social space, in orbit, or offline. Any items not found on your character will be ignored.

responses.label: The results of a bulk Equipping operation performed through the Destiny API.

routes.documentation: Insert a plug into a socketed item. I know how it sounds, but I assure you it's much more G-rated than you might be guessing. We haven't decided yet whether this will be able to insert plugs that have side effects, but if we do it will require special scope permission for an application attempting to do so. You must have a valid Destiny Account, and either be in a social space, in orbit, or offline. Request must include proof of permission for 'InsertPlugs' from the account owner.

responses.label: Look at the Response property for more information about the nature of this response

routes.documentation: Extract an item from the Postmaster, with whatever implications that may entail. You must have a valid Destiny account. You must also pass BOTH a reference AND an instance ID if it's an instanced item.

responses.label: Look at the Response property for more information about the nature of this response

routes.documentation: Set the Lock State for an instanced item. You must have a valid Destiny Account.

responses.label: Look at the Response property for more information about the nature of this response

routes.documentation: Set the Tracking State for an instanced item, if that item is a Quest or Bounty. You must have a valid Destiny Account. Yeah, it's an item.

responses.label: Look at the Response property for more information about the nature of this response

routes.documentation: Transfer an item to/from your vault. You must have a valid Destiny account. You must also pass BOTH a reference AND an instance ID if it's an instanced item. itshappening.gif

responses.label: Look at the Response property for more information about the nature of this response

routes.documentation: Gets a page list of Destiny items.

responses.label: The results of a search for Destiny content. This will be improved on over time, I've been doing some experimenting to see what might be useful.

routes.documentation: Provide the result of the user interaction. Called by the Bungie Destiny App to approve or reject a request.

responses.label: Look at the Response property for more information about the nature of this response

routes.documentation: Returns the action token if user approves the request.

responses.label: Look at the Response property for more information about the nature of this response

routes.documentation: Initialize a request to perform an advanced write action.

responses.label: Look at the Response property for more information about the nature of this response

routes.documentation: Returns information on the weekly clan rewards and if the clan has earned them or not. Note that this will always report rewards as not redeemed.

responses.label: Represents a runtime instance of a user's milestone status. Live Milestone data should be combined with DestinyMilestoneDefinition data to show the user a picture of what is available for them to do in the game, and their status in regards to said "things to do." Consider it a big, wonky to-do list, or Advisors 3.0 for those who remember the Destiny 1 API.

routes.documentation: Returns the current version of the manifest as a json object.

responses.label: DestinyManifest is the external-facing contract for just the properties needed by those calling the Destiny Platform.

routes.documentation: Returns the static definition of an entity of the given Type and hash identifier. Examine the API Documentation for the Type Names of entities that have their own definitions. Note that the return type will always *inherit from* DestinyDefinition, but the specific type returned will be the requested entity type if it can be found. Please don't use this as a chatty alternative to the Manifest database if you require large sets of data, but for simple and one-off accesses this should be handy.

responses.label: Provides common properties for destiny definitions.

routes.documentation: Gets public information about currently available Milestones.

responses.label: Look at the Response property for more information about the nature of this response

routes.documentation: Gets custom localized content for the milestone of the given hash, if it exists.

responses.label: Represents localized, extended content related to Milestones. This is intentionally returned by a separate endpoint and not with Character-level Milestone data because we do not put localized data into standard Destiny responses, both for brevity of response and for caching purposes. If you really need this data, hit the Milestone Content endpoint.

routes.documentation: Returns a list of Destiny memberships given a full Gamertag or PSN ID. Unless you pass returnOriginalProfile=true, this will return membership information for the users' Primary Cross Save Profile if they are engaged in cross save rather than any original Destiny profile that is now being overridden.

responses.label: Look at the Response property for more information about the nature of this response

routes.documentation: Gets aggregated stats for a clan using the same categories as the clan leaderboards. PREVIEW: This endpoint is still in beta, and may experience rough edges. The schema is in final form, but there may be bugs that prevent desirable operation.

responses.label: Look at the Response property for more information about the nature of this response

routes.documentation: Gets historical stats definitions.

responses.label: Look at the Response property for more information about the nature of this response

routes.documentation: Gets leaderboards with the signed in user's friends and the supplied destinyMembershipId as the focus. PREVIEW: This endpoint is still in beta, and may experience rough edges. The schema is in final form, but there may be bugs that prevent desirable operation.

responses.label: Look at the Response property for more information about the nature of this response

routes.documentation: Gets leaderboards with the signed in user's friends and the supplied destinyMembershipId as the focus. PREVIEW: This endpoint is still in beta, and may experience rough edges. The schema is in final form, but there may be bugs that prevent desirable operation.

responses.label: Look at the Response property for more information about the nature of this response

routes.documentation: Gets the available post game carnage report for the activity ID.

responses.label: Look at the Response property for more information about the nature of this response

routes.documentation: Report a player that you met in an activity that was engaging in ToS-violating activities. Both you and the offending player must have played in the activityId passed in. Please use this judiciously and only when you have strong suspicions of violation, pretty please.

responses.label: Look at the Response property for more information about the nature of this response

routes.documentation: Get items available from vendors where the vendors have items for sale that are common for everyone. If any portion of the Vendor's available inventory is character or account specific, we will be unable to return their data from this endpoint due to the way that available inventory is computed. As I am often guilty of saying: 'It's a long story...'

responses.label:
A response containing all valid components for the public Vendors endpoint.
 It is a decisively smaller subset of data compared to what we can get when we know the specific user making the request.
 If you want any of the other data - item details, whether or not you can buy it, etc... you'll have to call in the context of a character. I know, sad but true.

routes.documentation: Gets historical stats for indicated character.

responses.label: Look at the Response property for more information about the nature of this response

routes.documentation: Gets activity history stats for indicated character.

responses.label: Look at the Response property for more information about the nature of this response

routes.documentation: Gets all activities the character has participated in together with aggregate statistics for those activities.

responses.label: Look at the Response property for more information about the nature of this response

routes.documentation: Gets details about unique weapon usage, including all exotic weapons.

responses.label: Look at the Response property for more information about the nature of this response

routes.documentation: Gets aggregate historical stats organized around each character for a given account.

responses.label: Look at the Response property for more information about the nature of this response

routes.documentation: Gets leaderboards with the signed in user's friends and the supplied destinyMembershipId as the focus. PREVIEW: This endpoint has not yet been implemented. It is being returned for a preview of future functionality, and for public comment/suggestion/preparation.

responses.label: Look at the Response property for more information about the nature of this response

routes.documentation: Returns Destiny Profile information for the supplied membership.

responses.label: The response for GetDestinyProfile, with components for character and item-level data.

routes.documentation: Returns character information for the supplied character.

responses.label: The response contract for GetDestinyCharacter, with components that can be returned for character and item-level data.

routes.documentation: Given a Presentation Node that has Collectibles as direct descendants, this will return item details about those descendants in the context of the requesting character.

responses.label: Returns the detailed information about a Collectible Presentation Node and any Collectibles that are direct descendants.

routes.documentation: Get currently available vendors from the list of vendors that can possibly have rotating inventory. Note that this does not include things like preview vendors and vendors-as-kiosks, neither of whom have rotating/dynamic inventories. Use their definitions as-is for those.

responses.label: A response containing all of the components for all requested vendors.

routes.documentation: Get the details of a specific Vendor.

responses.label: A response containing all of the components for a vendor.

routes.documentation: Retrieve the details of an instanced Destiny Item. An instanced Destiny item is one with an ItemInstanceId. Non-instanced items, such as materials, have no useful instance-specific details and thus are not queryable here.

responses.label: The response object for retrieving an individual instanced item. None of these components are relevant for an item that doesn't have an "itemInstanceId": for those, get your information from the DestinyInventoryDefinition.

routes.documentation: Returns a summary information about all profiles linked to the requesting membership type/membership ID that have valid Destiny information. The passed-in Membership Type/Membership ID may be a Bungie.Net membership or a Destiny membership. It only returns the minimal amount of data to begin making more substantive requests, but will hopefully serve as a useful alternative to UserServices for people who just care about Destiny data. Note that it will only return linked accounts whose linkages you are allowed to view.

responses.label:
I know what you seek. You seek linked accounts. Found them, you have.
This contract returns a minimal amount of data about Destiny Accounts that are linked through your Bungie.Net account. We will not return accounts in this response whose

routes.documentation: Gets a count of all active non-public fireteams for the specified clan. Maximum value returned is 25.

responses.label: Look at the Response property for more information about the nature of this response

routes.documentation: Gets a listing of all of this clan's fireteams that are have available slots. Caller is not checked for join criteria so caching is maximized.

routes.documentation: Gets a listing of all fireteams that caller is an applicant, a member, or an alternate of.

routes.documentation: Gets a specific fireteam.

routes.documentation: Gets a listing of all public fireteams starting now with open slots. Caller is not checked for join criteria so caching is maximized.

routes.documentation: Returns a thread of posts starting at the topicId of the input childPostId, optionally returning replies to those posts as well as the original parent.

routes.documentation: Returns the detailed results for a specific trending entry. Note that trending entries are uniquely identified by a combination of *both* the TrendingEntryType *and* the identifier: the identifier alone is not guaranteed to be globally unique.
